page.title: 11THE LANDSCAPE OF EAST WELLOW
page.content:
The landscape of East Wellow is basically a rural one, but one that is also changing. Farms are becoming bigger and highly mechanised and this means that big fields are needed for crop growing. Crop growing is concentrated in the east of this area and this is where the enlargement of fields and removal of areas of woodland and hedges has been most notable. Some new woodlands have been planted, especially poplar plantations, which are a characteristic of this area of Hampshire.
Agricultural land uses dominate the area completely.The west is dominated by grassland in smaller fields for livestock important among which are horses. The east of the area has more arable land,but also more woodland.
